definitions.definition: construct (something, typically something large) by putting parts or material together over a period of time.
synonyms: shape "they were building a tree house"

definitions.definition: commission, finance, and oversee the building of (something).
examples: the city council plans to build a bridge

definitions.definition: incorporate (something) and make it a permanent part of a structure, system, or situation.
examples: engineers want to build in extra traction
synonyms: assimilate into "emergency procedures must be built into every plan"

definitions.definition: establish and develop (a business, relationship, or situation) over a period of time.
examples: he'd built up the store from nothing
synonyms: initiate More"they are building a business strategy"establish
enlarge "he built up a huge business"

definitions.definition: use as a basis for further progress or development.
examples: the nation should build on the talents of its workforce
synonyms: perfect "we are now in a position to build on all the wonderful legwork that our staff has accomplished"

definitions.definition: increase the size, intensity, or extent of.
examples: we built up confidence in our abilities
synonyms: swell; informalbeef up "she built up her stamina"
